Speaker: darkness
Dialogue: A LOW RUMBLE increases in volume.

Speaker: white
Dialogue: What?  I...  How long have I been here?

Speaker: bumstead
Dialogue: I know, sir, but I can't make it at nine-thirty...  It's  -  um  -  well, inconvenient...

Speaker: bumstead
Dialogue: Yes, sir...  I understand...  Yes... But, I've done fine so far without an assistant...

Speaker: bumstead
Dialogue: But...  But I...  I...  Nine-thirty.  Yes.

Speaker: mystery man
Dialogue: Co-operate.  Do not make this difficult.

Speaker: mystery man
Dialogue: You will not shoot, yes.  There is a place in your mind, a corner of darkness...

Speaker: mortician
Dialogue: Welcome, gentlemen.  Youre early. Here for the examination, right?

Speaker: stromboli
Dialogue: The handiwork of an extremely sick individual.

Speaker: stromboli
Dialogue: Youve read the reports.  Not much to go on.  We know nothing about him, except that he likes to cut them... Always the same type of blade. Forensics match in each case... Anyway, it's all in the reports, read them for yourself.

Speaker: stromboli
Dialogue: Why are you wearing that thing on your face?

Speaker: bumstead
Dialogue: Germs, sir.  These places are full of them.

Speaker: stromboli
Dialogue: I see.  One things for sure, hes ambitious. Youll be a busy man from now on.

Speaker: bumstead
Dialogue: What about Thompson, sir?  Wasnt this his case?

Speaker: stromboli
Dialogue: Thompson suffered a kind of severe delusion or some damn thing.  Anyway he isnt with us any longer.  The case is yours.  Go through his files. Take what you need.  By the way, hows your mother?

Speaker: stromboli
Dialogue: Lets go, Bumstead.  So much to do and so little time.

Speaker: figure 1
Dialogue: We are looking for Jonathan White.

Speaker: man 1
Dialogue: Dont fall asleep.  Might never wake, yes.

Speaker: fredrick
Dialogue: Cmon, lets go!  We dont have any time.

Speaker: white
Dialogue: Hold it a minute.  Lets start at the beginning, huh?

Speaker: bumstead
Dialogue: Dont ever sneak up on me like that! Who are you?

Speaker: miss crenshaw
Dialogue: The Chief-Inspector thought you might need a hand.

Speaker: miss crenshaw
Dialogue: Ive taken the liberty and had Inspector Thompsons office searched, as I believe you instructed.  All clear now, sir.  They found several more traps and things were filed under pretty strange categories... Poor man.

Speaker: white
Dialogue: Keep newspapers here, birth certificates, records of deaths, that kind of thing?

Speaker: white
Dialogue: Im trying to reach nine zero eight triple two.  I cant get through...  Shit!

Speaker: white
Dialogue: It is?...  Which area is that number listed in?...  Is that near the ocean?...  The ocean...  Never mind. Have a Jonathan White listed?... WHITE.  Seventeen?  All Johns?  I see...  Never mind.

Speaker: bumstead
Dialogue: What?  I dont drink coffee.  A cup of tea would be good.  Milk and no sugar.

Speaker: bumstead
Dialogue: These are the investigations of a madman.  He has fabricated an entire bizarre paranoid delusion with no internal logic whatever.  Its the second time now.

Speaker: bumstead
Dialogue: Do you wash your hands before you type things?

Speaker: miss crenshaw
Dialogue: Yes, sir.  The Chief-Inspector said he would see you now.

Speaker: bumstead
Dialogue: A formality.  I need to speak with Thompson.  Officially I need your written permission.

Speaker: stromboli
Dialogue: Why do you want to speak to him?

Speaker: bumstead
Dialogue: A hunch.  He might be able to...

Speaker: bumstead
Dialogue: Its extremely important to my investigation...

Speaker: stromboli
Dialogue: Ill be the judge of that.  Anything else?

Speaker: bumstead
Dialogue: Actually, I was wondering, sir, if you could let me have a few uniforms, to follow up for me...

Speaker: stromboli
Dialogue: What makes you think that!  If you would learn to concentrate on facts, not get so side-tracked  -  you might get things done faster, Bumstead...

Speaker: white
Dialogue: I need something to keep me awake.

Speaker: barber
Dialogue: Looks like you need a haircut to me.

Speaker: barber
Dialogue: Only two bucks.  Shave as well...

Speaker: barber
Dialogue: Tell you what  -  let me cut yer hair, give ya watcha need half price. Cant argue at that!

Speaker: white
Dialogue: The city.  I need to get to the ocean.

Speaker: barber
Dialogue: Nope.  No maps.  Ocean, huh?  On vacation?

Speaker: barber
Dialogue: Grandpa thought customers might like some mood music.

Speaker: barber
Dialogue: You still look familiar.  Its driving me nuts!  Sure I dont know ya from somewhere?

Speaker: barber
Dialogue: Mnunn.  Cold lately.  That night, couple weeks ago.  That was real cold.  Remember that?

Speaker: barber
Dialogue: Yeah, Im like that.  Senility says the wife.  But she sure cant complain.  Heh.  The erector set still works good.  And this aint no fucking rug! Ghead.  Feel it!  All mine!

Speaker: priest
Dialogue: Beware!  The night is deadly.  There is a criminal among us.

Speaker: priest
Dialogue: It could be she!  The innocent across the street!

Speaker: priest
Dialogue: Or mister nervy stranger at the back!

Speaker: priest
Dialogue: You are thinking it could be anyone? And youre right!  Why, it could even be Mother!

Speaker: gaunt woman
Dialogue: He took my little boy!  Ill rip out his eyes!

Speaker: priest
Dialogue: Then we must call the police.

Speaker: white
Dialogue: No.  I mean...  that isnt necessary.

Speaker: priest
Dialogue: I see.  Then who is after you?  What sins have you committed?

Speaker: white
Dialogue: Just let me sit here for a moment? Ill go soon, and stop bothering you.

Speaker: priest
Dialogue: Youre the murderer?  Yes!  That must be it!  Dont kill me!

Speaker: white
Dialogue: Shut up!  Listen.  Walk out quietly.  Understand?

Speaker: bumstead
Dialogue: How long have you been here?

Speaker: white
Dialogue: I want to see the doctor.  It's important.

Speaker: man 5
Dialogue: What about the dance-steps!  This is my responsibility, we must resolve this issue, yes?

Speaker: man 3
Dialogue: The situation has changed.  This one is in possession of knowledge...

Speaker: man 2
Dialogue: Stop this!  It has gone too far! Tell Mister Black!

Speaker: schreber
Dialogue: You remember nothing?  Who you are? What you've done?

Speaker: schreber
Dialogue: Ah, that would be cheating, wouldn't it?  Is there nothing you remember?  Not even a detail?   You must try.

Speaker: white
Dialogue: You think I haven't been trying!  Just water.

Speaker: white
Dialogue: Waves...  A beach.  A woman whispering.  That's all.  I need to stay awake.  Do you have any pills?

Speaker: schreber
Dialogue: What does she say?  The woman.

Speaker: white
Dialogue: Asks my name.  Over and over.  Just like a broken record.  Only thing is, I can't answer.  I've no idea what my name is.

Speaker: white
Dialogue: That's what people keep telling me.

Speaker: white
Dialogue: You're supposed to be my doctor, right?

Speaker: schreber
Dialogue: That's right.  I am your doctor.

Speaker: schreber
Dialogue: I cannot say...  You don't know the answer to that?

Speaker: white
Dialogue: I told you, I can't remember a thing!

Speaker: schreber
Dialogue: We won't get anywhere like this. Please.  Let's take things in easy steps...

Speaker: schreber
Dialogue: Put simply...  a penetration of the left parieto-occipital area of the cranium...  complicated by inflammation that resulted in adhesions of the brain to the meninges.  Without going into detail...  the formation of scar tissue altered the configuration of the lateral ventricles, producing incipient atrophy of the medulla...

Speaker: white
Dialogue: Did she drown?  The woman you told me about?

Speaker: schreber
Dialogue: Not exactly.  She was found in a canal, disembowelled.  Throat cut. Blood drained.  The body wrapped in a bed-sheet.

Speaker: schreber
Dialogue: You remember nothing, eh?  Let me show you something.

Speaker: schreber
Dialogue: Formation of memories is the most important of brain functions.

Speaker: schreber
Dialogue: We are little more than a sum of memories.  From them we reference who we are, where we're going.  Without a past we are nothing.  This is why you are so interesting.

Speaker: white
Dialogue: Can I get my life back?

Speaker: schreber
Dialogue: We know of two kinds of memory. Firstly, declarative memory.

Speaker: schreber
Dialogue: And then there is procedural memory.

Speaker: schreber
Dialogue: Research on simple animals can be... useful.  To show us where memory storing systems are located, for example.  I am building an experiment with hamsters next.  Cute little things.

Speaker: schreber
Dialogue: Listen to me talk!  You must be hungry.

Speaker: schreber
Dialogue: Whole damn wing lost power.  Wiring's old.  Keep meaning to get it fixed. Here we are.

Speaker: schreber
Dialogue: Ah.  Beautiful!  Head and all!  Just how I like 'em!

Speaker: schreber
Dialogue: I don't blame you for getting angry. You are in a frustrating situation. You must be patient though.  Trust me completely.  I'm here to help.

Speaker: schreber
Dialogue: Ah, nearly done.  So tell me about your dreams.  I'm very interested.

Speaker: white
Dialogue: Just the typical fabrications of a distorted mind.  You know, chased by mysterious men in black, that kind of thing...

Speaker: schreber
Dialogue: Ah, our friends in black...  they are not just a figment of your imagination you know, in fact none of what you are experiencing is anything but real.

Speaker: schreber
Dialogue: I know everything about you.  You have no choice but to trust me.

Speaker: schreber
Dialogue: You can't go yet.  We've got so much to talk about...

Speaker: schreber
Dialogue: You're tired.  You need to lie down.

Speaker: foetus 1
Dialogue: This is madness.  If we're caught...

Speaker: foetus 2
Dialogue: Shut-up.  Help me with these straps...

Speaker: schreber
Dialogue: Damn!  Whoever it is  -  get rid of them!

Speaker: schreber
Dialogue: I'm sorry I had to put you through this, Anton.  There will be some pain, but things will be easier this way.

Speaker: bumstead
Dialogue: Dammit!  I'm curious?  How many so far?

Speaker: bumstead
Dialogue: The six year old.  Sure, you remember.

Speaker: bumstead
Dialogue: You sure have demonstrated a great deal of...  imagination.  The baby was the best though.  Several cops lost their lunch over that one.  Head twisted off, spine pulled out, yeech...

Speaker: bumstead
Dialogue: We count seven so far.  Anyone we missed?

Speaker: crenshaw
Dialogue: Just reminding you...  your eight pee em...

Speaker: bumstead
Dialogue: Dammit.  Very efficient, as usual, Crenshaw. Remind me to give you my watch.  It needs fixing.

Speaker: bumstead
Dialogue: Bumstead.  I'm here to see my mother.

Speaker: schreber
Dialogue: You're innocent...  You didn't kill anyone.

Speaker: schreber
Dialogue: Listen to what I have to say.  Decide for yourself.

Speaker: cop
Dialogue: Says he is the man's doctor...  You know...

Speaker: bumstead
Dialogue: I know it's his doctor...  Daniel Paul Schreber M.D.

Speaker: schreber
Dialogue: The men in black  -  they're the killers.

Speaker: white
Dialogue: So you're telling me the truth this time?  Is that it!

Speaker: schreber
Dialogue: If you would only take this, inject it in your brain, everything would be much clearer.

Speaker: schreber
Dialogue: Everyone get's one  -  very much like this...  But this one's special.  It will help you understand, everything...

Speaker: schreber
Dialogue: Anton  -  I mean, John, there has been an experiment, a dangerous experiment.  I arranged it.  It was a lie from the beginning.  It almost worked, but things did not go as they should have.  You have been left  - blank.

Speaker: schreber
Dialogue: You can change this, all this.  But you must take it.

Speaker: schreber
Dialogue: Please!  Don't be foolish!  Time is short.  Let me show you something. Look at this syringe.

Speaker: schreber
Dialogue: Don't ask stupid questions.  Look at it.

Speaker: schreber
Dialogue: Concentrate.  Imagine the syringe rising.  Picture it floating above the table.

Speaker: schreber
Dialogue: No it isn't.  You are doing it!  Now raise it over the glass and...

Speaker: bumstead
Dialogue: Really?  And how is his state of mind?

Speaker: bumstead
Dialogue: You seem a little edgy.  Everything okay?

Speaker: bumstead
Dialogue: To tell you the truth, I'm glad we've run into each other like this.  Maybe you can help me tidy some loose ends.

Speaker: stromboli
Dialogue: I need to speak to you.  Immediately.

Speaker: stromboli
Dialogue: Bumstead, these...  er, gentlemen are here to collect White.

Speaker: bumstead
Dialogue: This is highly irregular.  I have a right to know.

Speaker: man 1
Dialogue: We are from a mental asylum.

Speaker: stromboli
Dialogue: Yes.  That's right.  He's ill  -  he needs expert help.

Speaker: man 1
Dialogue: Yes, Inspector.  Has he been displaying any strange...  behaviour?

Speaker: stromboli
Dialogue: If you could show them to the holding cell now.

Speaker: bumstead
Dialogue: Yes, sir.  I'm sorry...  But I don't understand how it was possible.  The only window was twenty feet up a vertical wall, he was cuffed...

Speaker: stromboli
Dialogue: How could you have been so stupid?

Speaker: stromboli
Dialogue: Bumstead, you're starting to annoy me.  This case is very important to me.  Just a little warning:  I've got my eye on you inspector, remember that.

Speaker: japanese woman
Dialogue: He's up here!  He raped me!  Hurry! Before he kills again!

Speaker: white
Dialogue: Do I look like a murderer to you?

Speaker: white
Dialogue: Who is this?  What do you know about me?

Speaker: woman
Dialogue: Please believe me.  It's me, John. Your WIFE.  I wouldn't lie to you. You told me I could come and see you -  now you want to just send me away again...

Speaker: white
Dialogue: I thought it would make more sense. I'm getting the pieces, but when I put it together it feels like... Like you're telling me about somebody else's life...

Speaker: wife
Dialogue: It's the truth...  I need you.  I know you're innocent.

Speaker: white
Dialogue: How do you know I'm innocent?

Speaker: wife
Dialogue: Of course you are.  You couldn't do those terrible things.  Come home with me  -  maybe things will make sense then...

Speaker: white
Dialogue: I can't do that.  It's dangerous. What about my parents?  Do you know where I can find them?

Speaker: wife
Dialogue: You have an uncle.  You were very close.

Speaker: wife
Dialogue: This is where he lives. I'm sure he would like to see you.

Speaker: white
Dialogue: How do I get there?  Tell me.

Speaker: bumstead
Dialogue: I'm on the serial killer case, need to talk.

Speaker: bumstead
Dialogue: You don't look so well...  C'mon, let me in Thompson.

Speaker: thompson
Dialogue: I can't talk about that.  As long as you understand, that's all.

Speaker: thompson
Dialogue: Pull up some garbage  -  make yourself at home.

Speaker: thompson
Dialogue: They've taken my mind, my memories...

Speaker: thompson
Dialogue: Is that your idea of a joke?  I don't remember...  Take my advice, Bumstead.  Get off this case.  Now.

Speaker: bumstead
Dialogue: Jesus!  We have to get you to a doctor...

Speaker: bumstead
Dialogue: But...  How long has this been happening?

Speaker: thompson
Dialogue: A few days...  a few weeks  -  dunno, I can't remember.  Worse thing is, I never know if it will change back again...  Now, please leave me alone.

Speaker: mystery man
Dialogue: The line of junction between two edges!

Speaker: mystery man
Dialogue: We have located him.  Now is the time, yes.

Speaker: cop
Dialogue: All the same entry wounds.  It's definitely him.  She lives...  lived here.  A prostitute.

Speaker: bumstead
Dialogue: Jesus.  Small world.  Where's the photographer?

Speaker: cop
Dialogue: This is the family of the victim  - apparently they were in the apartment when he committed...

Speaker: cop
Dialogue: Well, sir...  I don't know exactly.

Speaker: bumstead
Dialogue: It's alright.  I won't hurt you.

Speaker: mister black
Dialogue: I have called this meeting for a purpose, yes?  It is clear to you we are  - unhappy, yes?

Speaker: mister black
Dialogue: The tuning failed  -  when our agents arrived he was gone.  He knows things -  predicts things.  Explain to us, Doctor.  Why is the situation this way?  Yes?

Speaker: schreber
Dialogue: I'm not certain I fully understand myself...

Speaker: mister black
Dialogue: No excuses, dearest Doctor!  Answers. Yes?

Speaker: mister black
Dialogue: You said this would be containable! Nothing works this time.  Why is this so?

Speaker: schreber
Dialogue: I  -  ah  -  I...  it's a little cold in here don't you think?

Speaker: mister black
Dialogue: We must find him.  This is your responsibility.

Speaker: miss crenshaw
Dialogue: Won't say.  Says he must talk to you.

Speaker: bumstead
Dialogue: This is Bumstead.  Who is this?

Speaker: bumstead
Dialogue: I need everything on the Jonathan White case.

Speaker: bumstead
Dialogue: All the important stuff.  Wrap it up for me.

Speaker: white
Dialogue: I  -  ah - couldn't think of anything else to do.  I thought maybe you know something...  I'm scared.

Speaker: bumstead
Dialogue: That was a pretty good escape act at the station.  How did you do that?

Speaker: white
Dialogue: I woke up in a subway.  I don't know how I got there.

Speaker: white
Dialogue: I don't know who they are.

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: What is your name...  What is your name...

Speaker: mister black
Dialogue: You have duplicated the personality, yes.

Speaker: man 3
Dialogue: It is ready.  The Doctor was most helpful.

Speaker: mister black
Dialogue: I hear a clock in my head, and I like it!

Speaker: bumstead
Dialogue: Please.  Not that way.  If you could just follow the covering  -  the carpet gets stained and it's impossible to clean.

Speaker: bumstead
Dialogue: Everything the department knows about John White is in this.  Here.  Excuse me for a moment.

Speaker: bumstead
Dialogue: You're case has been driving me crazy.  You see, I pride myself on being thorough.  There's too many loose ends with your case.  Thought it was best you were hidden until we understand more about the facts.  What do you know about these men in black?

Speaker: white
Dialogue: If you shoot them here...  you can kill them.  They're not people  -  like us  -  got insects in their heads...  Got any disinfectant?

Speaker: bumstead
Dialogue: Here.  Careful with your trousers.  That stuff stains.

Speaker: bumstead
Dialogue: Any idea what part the Doctor plays in this business?

Speaker: bumstead
Dialogue: Let's try and find out, shall we.  Lace is untied.

Speaker: bumstead
Dialogue: I didn't tell you the entire reason I helped you.  It started with two little girls.  Twins.  Used to play with them when I was young.  Couldn't remember for the life of me what they looked like, then I understood why...

Speaker: bumstead
Dialogue: That's right.  Just seamless flesh across the front of their heads.  No mistake.  I just hadn't remembered it that way.  Up until then they had been normal little girls in my memory.  That's not all.  Once I started examining them, all sorts of things about my life, had... inconsistencies.  It was like a game. I would think about a person or a place, or an event.  Then I would turn the lights off.  Sit down in a comfortable chair...  And study each detail of this subject.

Speaker: bumstead
Dialogue: Everything was liquid beneath a thin surface that had always seemed solid to me...

Speaker: bumstead
Dialogue: Is there anything you haven't told me about this business?  Even the most insignificant thing?

Speaker: white
Dialogue: Well.  The only thing I've been certain of, all this time, is that I need to get to the ocean.  The point is no one seems to know how to get there.

Speaker: bumstead
Dialogue: We'll get to the bottom of this.  I mean it.

Speaker: bumstead
Dialogue: I met a friend of yours the other night, doctor.  Tall fellow.  No hair.  Rather pale skin...

Speaker: schreber
Dialogue: I don't know what you're talking about.

Speaker: bumstead
Dialogue: That's surprising.  He was leaving your office at the time...

Speaker: bumstead
Dialogue: I think it's time you introduced us to your little friends.

Speaker: schreber
Dialogue: You wouldn't believe me if I told you, Inspector.  Have patience  - you'll see for yourself.

Speaker: white
Dialogue: Where do you think this goes?

Speaker: schreber
Dialogue: Follow me, and do exactly as I do.

Speaker: men
Dialogue: NIGHT OF THE EYE!  NIGHT OF THE EYE!

Speaker: man 2
Dialogue: The Eye is too small for the head of the pin!

Speaker: man 3
Dialogue: What is it that floats on the water? The Eye!

Speaker: schreber
Dialogue: The eye.  Master of time and space!

Speaker: bumstead
Dialogue: The Eye  -  um  -  delicious with horseradish on rye!

Speaker: man 4
Dialogue: My spine will bend for the Eye!

Speaker: bumstead
Dialogue: Was that for real down there?

Speaker: bumstead
Dialogue: This ocean business...  I know where I can find a map.  I need to go back to the station.  Where will you be?

Speaker: white
Dialogue: I'll go see an uncle of mine.  Five  -  one  -  eight  -  three  -  double six  -  three...

Speaker: ticket seller
Dialogue: Yeah.  That's what I said!  What..?

Speaker: man
Dialogue: Are you alright?  What are you doing here?  Is this one of your jokes, John?  It's been so long, I thought you'd forgotten your uncle Karl?

Speaker: karl
Dialogue: And this is me again about  -  um  -  I would guess about twelve feet further to the right of the last shot.  Now just behind the wall is the hotel I stayed at  -  sweet little place...

Speaker: white
Dialogue: Yes?  Oh, it's you...  Yes...  My uncle apparently...  Just looking at some memories...  You have?  That's good.

Speaker: bumstead
Dialogue: At first I thought there was no way to get to the ocean...  The buildings are a barrier, no windows, no doors -  everything just, well, ends  -  only thing would be drill a hole.  But then, I saw it, one door, just one... Inside a tenement building...

Speaker: white
Dialogue: Where can we meet?...  Alright. Good...

Speaker: karl
Dialogue: Look!  This is a good one!

Speaker: white
Dialogue: There.  Behind the cabinet.  Where does it go?

Speaker: karl
Dialogue: Such a joker!  Like your father.

Speaker: karl
Dialogue: It must be a closet or something.

Speaker: karl
Dialogue: Don't trip over.  It's dark up there.

Speaker: karl
Dialogue: John, I didn't see you there.

Speaker: karl
Dialogue: Filthy beast!  Shoo!  Go on!  Shoo!

Speaker: nurse
Dialogue: I'm sorry.  I told you, she is being examined...

Speaker: surgeon
Dialogue: We will teach the pig to meddle in our affairs.  Yes.

Speaker: surgeon
Dialogue: Ah, Inspector Bumstead!  We are glad you are here  -  I'm afraid we have done all we can.  Yes.  Your Mother has passed.  Yes.

Speaker: surgeon
Dialogue: We are sorry.  The cancer  -  it was fatal.

Speaker: surgeon
Dialogue: We knew that.  Yes.  Anyway  -  she is dead.

Speaker: mystery man
Dialogue: You will obey us, yes.  In your mind there is a dark space...

Speaker: stromboli
Dialogue: Why do you always have to find things out the hard way!  Couldn't you just do your job, you idiot?  I told you, didn't I?  These people are not playing games, Bumstead.  They can do anything they want, don't you understand?

Speaker: stromboli
Dialogue: Time for that early retirement, Bumstead.  Didn't bring the gold watch I'm afraid.

Speaker: schreber
Dialogue: I had to  -  ahhhh  -  find you...  I.. I...

Speaker: schreber
Dialogue: We are...  living in their dreams...

Speaker: man 1
Dialogue: We are looking for the White victims.

Speaker: mortician
Dialogue: And who the hell are you?

Speaker: mortician
Dialogue: Over there.  Numbers eight to twelve.

Speaker: mystery man
Dialogue: There is nothing, Mister White. Beyond the city.  Never has been. Unfortunate.  Yes?

Speaker: white
Dialogue: How did you know where to find me?

Speaker: mystery man
Dialogue: We knew you would turn up here eventually...  Been waiting for you, yes.  Hoped you wouldn't make a nuisance of yourself on the way...

Speaker: mister black
Dialogue: John White, you are to be tried for murder, yes.  You wish to confess to these crimes now?

Speaker: mister black
Dialogue: Very well.  The testimony of the prosecutors.  Yes.

Speaker: mister black
Dialogue: Something to say?  Ready to confess?

Speaker: mister slack
Dialogue: You had your turn!  Let them speak.

Speaker: white
Dialogue: It was them, not me.  They killed you.

Speaker: white
Dialogue: You have invented all this.  History is a lie, not just mine, everyone's  - a fiction.  You are the authors.

Speaker: white
Dialogue: Everyone has a job  -  a function.  Each one teaches you more about your invention.  I'm what is called a murderer.

Speaker: white
Dialogue: You've given everybody memories, but I missed out.  The Doctor saw to that -  played your own game.  And now...

Speaker: white
Dialogue: You're trying to get rid of me.

Speaker: white
Dialogue: Why do I threaten you?  You're scared aren't you?

Speaker: mister black
Dialogue: Ah  -  a plot.  Now we have a plot!  Very inventive...

Speaker: mister black
Dialogue: A book of delusions.  Anything else?

Speaker: mister black
Dialogue: How dare you use your tricks on me!

Speaker: mister black
Dialogue: Shut up, freak!  Monster!  You are insignificant.

Speaker: mister black
Dialogue: This has all gone too far.  Yes, much too far.

Speaker: figure
Dialogue: Good as new.  Yes.  Everything is easier now.

Speaker: fat man
Dialogue: It's small but clean...  Isn't it?
